H0.text: General Franco, the Spanish military general, was head of state of Spain from October 1936 following the Spanish Civil War, until when. 1960

H1.text: General Franco, the Spanish military general, was head of state of Spain from October 1936 following the Spanish Civil War, until when. 1980

H2.text: General Franco, the Spanish military general, was head of state of Spain from October 1936 following the Spanish Civil War, until when. 1945

H3.text: General Franco, the Spanish military general, was head of state of Spain from October 1936 following the Spanish Civil War, until when. 1975

A5.text: In 1973, Franco resigned as prime minister—separated from the office of head of state since 1967—due to his advanced age and illness, but he remained head of state.

A6.text: After Franco's death in 1975, Juan Carlos succeeded him as the King of Spain.
